member.name: T:Microsoft.Azure.CognitiveServices.Language.TextAnalytics.ITextAnalyticsAPI
member.summary: The Text Analytics API is a suite of text analytics web services built with best-in-class Microsoft machine learning algorithms. The API can be used to analyze unstructured text for tasks such as sentiment analysis, key phrase extraction and language detection. No training data is needed to use this API; just bring your text data. This API uses advanced natural language processing techniques to deliver best in class predictions. Further documentation can be found in https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/azure/cognitive-services/text-analytics/overview

member.name: P:Microsoft.Azure.CognitiveServices.Language.TextAnalytics.ITextAnalyticsAPI.SerializationSettings
member.summary: The base URI of the service.
Gets or sets json serialization settings.

member.summary: Gets or sets json deserialization settings.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Azure.CognitiveServices.Language.TextAnalytics.ITextAnalyticsAPI.SubscriptionKey
member.summary: Subscription key in header

member.name: P:Microsoft.Azure.CognitiveServices.Language.TextAnalytics.ITextAnalyticsAPI.AzureRegion
member.summary: Supported Azure regions for Cognitive Services endpoints. Possible values include: 'westus', 'westeurope', 'southeastasia', 'eastus2', 'westcentralus'
The API returns a list of strings denoting the key talking points in the input text.
member.remarks: We employ techniques from Microsoft Office's sophisticated Natural Language Processing toolkit. See the Text Analytics Documentation for details about the languages that are supported by key phrase extraction.
member.param: Collection of documents to analyze. Documents can now contain a language field to indicate the text language
The headers that will be added to request.
The cancellation token.

member.summary: The API returns the detected language and a numeric score between 0 and 1.
member.remarks: Scores close to 1 indicate 100% certainty that the identified language is true. A total of 120 languages are supported.
member.param: Collection of documents to analyze.
(Optional. Deprecated) Number of languages to detect. Set to 1 by default. Irrespective of the value, the language with the highest score is returned.
The headers that will be added to request.
The cancellation token.

member.summary: The API returns a numeric score between 0 and 1.
member.remarks: Scores close to 1 indicate positive sentiment, while scores close to 0 indicate negative sentiment. Sentiment score is generated using classification techniques. The input features to the classifier include n-grams, features generated from part-of-speech tags, and word embeddings. See the Text Analytics Documentation for details about the languages that are supported by sentiment analysis.
member.param: Collection of documents to analyze.
The headers that will be added to request.
The cancellation token.
